It is to be understood that the phraseology or terminology herein is for the purpose of description and not of limitation, such that the terminology or phraseology of the present specification is to be interpreted by the skilled artisan in light of the teachings and guidance.

Embodiments of the present disclosure have been described above with the aid of functional building blocks illustrating the implementation of specified functions and relationships thereof. The boundaries of these functional building blocks have been arbitrarily defined herein for the convenience of the description. Alternate boundaries can be defined so long as the specified functions and relationships thereof are appropriately performed.

The Summary and Abstract sections may set forth one or more but not all exemplary embodiments of the present disclosure as contemplated by the inventor(s), and thus, are not intended to limit the present disclosure and the appended claims in any way.

The breadth and scope of the present disclosure should not be limited by any of the above-described exemplary embodiments, but should be defined only in accordance with the following claims and their equivalents.

claim.claim-text: 1. A three-dimensional (3D) memory device, comprising:an alternating dielectric stack comprising a plurality of dielectric layer pairs arranged in a vertical direction;an alternating conductor/dielectric stack comprising a plurality of conductor/dielectric layer pairs arranged in the vertical direction; andat least one through array contact extending through the alternating dielectric stack in the vertical direction;a barrier structure separates the alternating dielectric stack and the alternating conductor/dielectric stack, an opening of the barrier structure is at an edge of the alternating dielectric stack along a lateral direction, the lateral direction is perpendicular to the vertical direction.

2. The memory device of claim 1, wherein:the barrier structure comprising two parallel first sub-barrier structures and a second sub-barrier structure, the two parallel first sub-barrier structures extending along the lateral direction, the second sub-barrier structure connecting the two parallel first sub-barrier structures in a bit line direction, the bit line direction is perpendicular to the lateral direction.

3. The memory device of claim 2, further comprising:a channel structure region and a staircase region arranged in the lateral direction, a plurality of channel structures located in the channel structure region and extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack in the vertical direction;the alternating dielectric stack and the barrier structure are located in the staircase region;wherein the second sub-barrier structure is close to the channel structure region, and the opening is away from the channel structure region.

4. The memory device of claim 2, further comprising:a plurality of dummy channel structures extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack, wherein the plurality of dummy channel structures are located on both sides of the two parallel first sub-barrier structures along the bit line direction.
5. The memory device of claim 3, further comprising:a plurality of word line contacts on a staircase structure of the staircase region.
6. The memory device of claim 1, wherein:the alternating dielectric stack is defined by the barrier structure and the edge of the alternating dielectric stack in the staircase region.
7. The memory device of claim 1, wherein:at least one of the plurality of through array contacts is connected with at least one peripheral circuit.
8. The memory device of claim 1, wherein:each of the plurality of dielectric layer pairs comprising a first dielectric layer and a second dielectric layer different from the first dielectric layer.

9. The memory device of claim 1, further comprising:a first substrate with an interconnection structure;a second substrate disposed on the first substrate;wherein the at least one through array contact extends through the second substrate and connects to the interconnection structure.
10. The memory device of claim 1, wherein the barrier structure comprises silicon oxide.

11. The memory device of claim 1, wherein:each of the plurality of dielectric layer pairs comprises a silicon oxide layer and a silicon nitride layer; andeach of the plurality of conductor/dielectric layer pairs comprises a metal layer and a silicon oxide layer.

12. The memory device of claim 1, further comprising:a plurality of slit structures extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack along the lateral direction;the plurality of slit structures divide the alternating conductor/dielectric stack into a plurality of memory fingers.
13. The memory device of claim 12, wherein:the plurality of slit structures comprise conductive material.

14. The memory device of claim 1, further comprising:a plurality of first slit structures and a plurality of second slit structures, the plurality of first slit structures and the plurality of second slit structures extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack along the lateral direction;wherein the plurality of first slit structures are not aligned with the plurality of second slit structures in the lateral direction.

15. The memory device of claim 14, wherein:at least one of the second slit structures is between two neighboring first slit structures,the barrier structure is between two neighboring first slit structures.

16. A three-dimensional (3D) memory device, comprising:an alternating dielectric stack comprising a plurality of dielectric layer pairs arranged in a vertical direction;an alternating conductor/dielectric stack comprising a plurality of conductor/dielectric layer pairs arranged in the vertical direction; andat least one through array contact extending through the alternating dielectric stack in the vertical direction;a barrier structure separates the alternating dielectric stack and the alternating conductor/dielectric stack;a plurality of slit structures extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack along a lateral direction, the plurality of slit structures divide the alternating conductor/dielectric stack into a plurality of memory fingers, and the slit structures comprise conductive material;wherein, the lateral direction is perpendicular to the vertical direction.

17. The memory device of claim 16, wherein:the slit structures comprising a first plurality of slit structures and a second plurality of slit structures, the first plurality of slit structures and the second plurality of slit structures extending vertically through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack and laterally along the lateral direction;wherein the first plurality of slit structures are not aligned with the second plurality of slit structures in the lateral direction;at least one of the second slit structures is between two neighboring first slit structures, the barrier structure is between the two neighboring first slit structures.
18. The memory device of claim 16, wherein:at least one of the plurality of through array contacts is connected with at least one peripheral circuit.

19. The memory device of claim 16, wherein:the alternating dielectric stack and the alternating conductor/dielectric stack is separated by two parallel first sub-barrier structures extending along the lateral direction.

20. The memory device of claim 16, further comprising:a channel structure regions and a staircase region arranged in the lateral direction, a plurality of channel structures located in the channel structure regions and extending through the alternating conductor/dielectric stack in the vertical direction;the alternating dielectric stack and the barrier structure are located in the staircase region.
